extendedIngredients.name: baby arugula
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 cups packed baby arugula (1 1/2 ozs), divided

extendedIngredients.name: fava beans
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup shelled fresh fava beans (1 1/4 lbs in pods) or shelled fresh or frozen edamame (soybeans; 3/4 lbs in pods)
extendedIngredients.originalName: shelled fresh fava beans (1 1/4 lbs in pods) or shelled fresh or frozen edamame (soybeans; 3/4 lbs in pods)

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup plus 1 Tbsp extra-virgin olive oil, divided, plus additional for drizzling
extendedIngredients.originalName: extra-virgin olive oil, divided, plus additional for drizzling

extendedIngredients.name: pecorino
extendedIngredients.original: 3 Tbsps grated Pecorino Toscano or Parmigiano-Reggiano

title: Arugula And Fava-bean Crostini
summary: Arugulan And Fava-bean Crostini might be just the hor d'oeuvre you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains approximately 5g of protein, 8g of fat, and a total of 178 calories. This vegetarian recipe serves 8 and costs 57 cents per serving. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. Head to the store and pick up olive oil, baguette, pecorino toscano, and a few other things to make it today. It is a cheap recipe for fans of Mediterranean food. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 20 minutes. It is brought to you by thebittenword.typepad.com. Overall, this recipe earns a pretty good spoonacular score of 57%. Similar recipes include Arugulan and Fava-Bean Crostini, Fava Bean Crostini, and Fava Bean and Manchego Crostini.

winePairing.pairingText: Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio are great choices for Italian. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. You could try Badian a Coltibuono Cultusboni RS Chianti Classico ( half-bottle). Reviewers quite like it with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 11 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Badia a Coltibuono Cultusboni RS Chianti Classico ( half-bottle)
productMatches.description: It is a fruity, soft and typical wine that is particularly food friendly.
